RMP_Summary: Praised for excellent Chicago location, diverse student body, research opportunities, and access via CTA U-Pass. Criticized heavily for lack of social life ('commuter school' feel, empty weekends), inconsistent food quality/options, safety concerns in surrounding areas, and sometimes feeling impersonal or bureaucratic. Academics and professor quality seen as highly variable ('hit-or-miss'). DPT program is well-regarded but demanding; the campus environment might feel isolating for students needing strong cohort support.

RMP_FirstYear_Recs: Consider Alexander Aruin (PT, teaches related courses) based on rating. Check course relevance for other prerequisite profs (Bio, Chem, Phys).
RMP_Positive_Reviews: * Excellent location in [Chicago](https://www.chicago.gov/) providing many opportunities.; * City access via included [Ventra U-Pass](https://idcenter.uic.edu/cta-u-pass/) is a major plus.; * Many professors are intelligent & supportive (helpful office hours, accessible TAs).; * Good resources available like [Campus Recreation](https://recreation.uic.edu/) and [Writing Center](https://writingcenter.uic.edu/).; * Diverse student body and research opportunities.
RMP_Negative_Reviews: * Social life frequently criticized as lacking or difficult due to commuter school nature; campus often feels empty on weekends.; * Food quality inconsistent ('hit or miss'); * Some facilities issues reported (e.g., inconsistent wifi, dorm conditions).; * Safety in surrounding areas rated low in reviews, though specific incidents less detailed recently.; * Some departments or professors reported as disorganized or poor quality/unresponsive.
PublicTransitInfo: [Transit Score of 71:](https://www.walkscore.com/score/1200-w-harrison-st-chicago-il-60607) Excellent Transit - transit is convenient for most trips. UIC is extremely well-served by the [Chicago Transit Authority (CTA)](https://www.transitchicago.com/). Campus has direct 'L' access via Blue Line ([UIC-Halsted](https://www.transitchicago.com/station/UIC-Halsted/), [Racine](https://www.transitchicago.com/station/Racine/) stops) and Pink Line ([Polk](https://www.transitchicago.com/station/Polk/) stop near West Campus). Numerous CTA bus routes serve the area (e.g., #7, #8, #12, #60, #157). Eligible students receive a [Ventra U-PASS](https://idcenter.uic.edu/cta-u-pass/) for unlimited rides during terms. [Pace Suburban Bus](https://www.pacebus.com/) also serves UIC. Use [Ventra App](https://www.ventrachicago.com/app/) for planning.
DrivingParkingInfo: Driving is possible, but parking is challenging/costly. [UIC Parking Services](https://parking.uic.edu/) manages lots/garages ([Map PDF](https://parking.uic.edu/wp-content/uploads/sites/240/2024/07/ParkingMap_070824.pdf)). Permits required ([Student Permit Info](https://parking.uic.edu/permits-rates/student-permits/)). [Daily/Visitor Parking](https://parking.uic.edu/daily-visitor-parking/) available (rates vary). Given excellent transit, driving often less convenient.
CyclingInfo: [Bike Score of 83:](https://www.walkscore.com/score/1200-w-harrison-st-chicago-il-60607) Very Bikeable - biking is convenient for most trips. Chicago's [Divvy](https://divvybikes.com/) bike-share system has stations near UIC ([Student Membership Info](https://divvybikes.com/pricing/divvyforbusiness/student)). Campus is generally bikeable with expanding [city bike lanes](https://www.chicago.gov/city/en/depts/cdot/provdrs/bike.html). [Bicycling at UIC info](https://sustainability.uic.edu/transportation/biking/) includes rack locations and registration recommendation.
WalkingInfo: [Walk Score of 82:](https://www.walkscore.com/score/1200-w-harrison-st-chicago-il-60607) Very Walkable - most errands can be accomplished on foot. UIC's campus is large but generally walkable within East or West campus areas. Surrounding neighborhoods (Little Italy, University Village) offer walkable amenities. Walking between East/West campuses (~1 mile) can be lengthy. Use walkways, be aware of surroundings. Nearby healthcare includes [UI Health](https://hospital.uillinois.edu/). [Chicago Parks District](https://www.chicagoparkdistrict.com/).
RideShareTaxiInfo: Uber, Lyft, and traditional taxis readily available. Useful for direct travel, late nights, or areas not easily reached by CTA. Costs vary. [Zipcar](https://www.zipcar.com/universities/university-of-illinois-chicago) car sharing available on campus.
AirportAccessInfo: Both O'Hare ([ORD](https://www.flychicago.com/ohare/home/pages/default.aspx)) and Midway ([MDW](https://www.flychicago.com/midway/home/pages/default.aspx)) airports directly accessible via CTA 'L'. Blue Line ([UIC-Halsted](https://www.transitchicago.com/station/UIC-Halsted/), [Racine](https://www.transitchicago.com/station/Racine/) stops) serves ORD directly (~60-75 min). Orange Line serves MDW (requires transfer downtown, e.g., at Clark/Lake, to Blue/Pink Line to reach campus easily). Taxis/ride-sharing offer direct but more expensive options.
CampusShuttleInfo: UIC operates free shuttle services ([i-card required](https://idcenter.uic.edu/)). [Intracampus Bus Service](https://transportation.uic.edu/buses-and-shuttles/) connects East/West campuses via multiple routes ([Live Map](https://uic.transloc.com/)). [Night Ride](https://transportation.uic.edu/night-ride/) provides on-demand, point-to-point transport within boundaries during evenings (use [UIC Ride App](https://transportation.uic.edu/night-ride/using-the-uic-ride-app/)). [Paratransit services](https://transportation.uic.edu/paratransit-service/) available for those with disabilities. [UI Ride](https://www.uillinois.edu/UIRIDE) connects UIC with UIUC.

Check [Garage availability](https://services.utdallas.edu/transit/garages/). [Parking Map (PDF)](https://services.utdallas.edu/download/Parking_Map.pdf). CyclingInfo: [Bike Score of 79:](https://www.walkscore.com/score/800-w-campbell-rd-richardson-tx-75080) Very Bikeable - biking is convenient for most trips. [Bicycle info](https://services.utdallas.edu/transit/bike/) includes registration recommendation. Racks near every building. Some campus paths, but Richardson is generally car-centric. No dedicated campus bike share found.
WalkingInfo: [Walk Score of 50:](https://www.walkscore.com/score/800-w-campbell-rd-richardson-tx-75080) Somewhat Walkable - some errands can be accomplished on foot. UTD campus is large; walking between buildings is required and can be lengthy. Reviews mention ongoing construction impacting routes. Surrounding area is suburban; walking feasible primarily for campus navigation or adjacent apartments/shops. Local info: [City of Richardson](https://www.cor.net/), [Parks & Rec](https://www.cor.net/departments/parks-recreation).

AirportAccessInfo: Two main airports: Dallas/Fort Worth Int'l ([DFW](https://www.dfwairport.com/)) and Dallas Love Field ([DAL](https://www.dallas-lovefield.com/)), both ~30-45 min drive (traffic dependent). Ride-sharing recommended. Public transit via DART takes much longer: DART Rail Orange Line to DFW (requires bus connection like Comet Cruiser to station); DART Bus Route 524 (Love Link) connects DAL Inwood/Love Field Station to rail (requires transfer).
CampusShuttleInfo: UTD operates free shuttles ([UTD Parking & Transpo](https://services.utdallas.edu/transit/)). [Comet Cruiser](https://services.utdallas.edu/transit/cruiser/) (DART Route 883) connects campus, apartments, shopping, DART stations ([Map PDF](https://services.utdallas.edu/download/Comet_Cruiser_Map.pdf), [Live Tracker](https://services.utdallas.edu/transit/findbus/)). [Comet Cab](https://services.utdallas.edu/transit/cab/) provides on-demand, point-to-point rides within campus boundaries (evenings/late-night). Specialized routes like [CORE](https://services.utdallas.edu/transit/core/) and [TI-BMES](https://services.utdallas.edu/transit/tibmes/) serve specific buildings.

TransitionInfo: Widener offers a 3+3 DPT pathway. PT students utilize the [Clinical Anatomy Lab](https://www.widener.edu/student-experience/our-campus/campus-facilities/clinical-anatomy-lab).
